Key Match Events: Nick Castellanos homered in his first at bat, drew a two-out walk and scored the winning run in his penultimate plate appearance, made a lunging catch in right field to prevent the tying run from reaching base in the top of the eighth, and was plunked again in the bottom of the eighth.
Weston Wilson drove in the game-winning run, marking the third straight game that the winning run was driven in by a reserve player who was called up from Triple-A Lehigh Valley.

In this series the Phillies got a walk off hit by Kody Clemens, a tiebreaking, pinch hit double by Cal Stevenson, the game-winning fister down the third base line by Wilson on Wednesday and important contributions from Buddy Kennedy in the first two games (A walk to set up Clemens heroics and an RBI single) and three excellent defensive plays by fourth-string catcher Aramis Ramirez, most notably throwing out the tying run trying to steal second base in the ninth inning.
Post-Match Reflections: Nick Castellanos appreciated the apology from Rays' manager Kevin Cash for the intentional hit during the previous game.
Weston Wilson commented on the trust the Phillies put in their players, which has helped them flourish in big situations.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Phillies swept the Rays and trimmed their magic number to win their first N.L. East crown since 2011 down to nine.
The Phillies are 14-4 in their last 18 games and have reached 30 games over .500 for the first time all season.
